Section 5.2 · Collaboration

Collaboration and Division of Labor

Figure 9: Overview of Agentic Collaboration

In-context Collaboration:

  • Cascading: Manually design cascading calls with 1-best decoding
  • Hierarchical: Manually design with manager, worker roles
  • Role-based: Automated assigning from LLM discussions

Post-training Collaboration:

  • Prompt Opt.: Refine task-specific prompts with multi-agent feedback
  • Graph-based Opt.: Model topology as graphs for optimization
  • Policy-based Opt.: Learn agent-specific update and selection policies

5.2 Collaboration and Division of Labor

Collaboration and division of labor constitute a central organizing principle in modern multi-agent systems. Instead of treating agents as homogeneous components, recent work emphasizes how responsibilities are decomposed and coordinated across specialized agents to improve efficiency and robustness.

Analysis & Explanation

Collaboration Architectures

Design Trade-offs
  • Cascading: Simple, predictable, but rigid
  • Hierarchical: Scalable, clear accountability, coordination overhead
  • Role-based: Flexible, emergent behavior, harder to control
